snippet: A casino license, particularly within a leisurely drive of New York City, could be a golden ticket to billions in profits in one of the last underdeveloped gambling markets in the nation.
abstract: Twenty-two entities vying to build casinos in New York State are spending heavily on lobbyists and making significant political contributions, including some $55,000 to Gov Andrew M Cuomo; intense competition reflects one of last underdeveloped gambling markets in the nation, where casino license could be a golden ticket to billions in profits.

byline.original: By JESSE McKINLEY and CHARLES V. BAGLI

lead_paragraph: A casino license, particularly within a leisurely drive of New York City, could be a golden ticket to billions in profits in one of the last underdeveloped gambling markets in the nation.

headline.main: Bidders Lining Up Lobbyists in Fight for New York Casinos
headline.print_headline: Bidders Lining Up Lobbyists in Fight for New York Casinos
